reassurance: [EMPATHY - PAUSE BETWEEN SENTENCES] I know this is devastating news, and I'm truly sorry. Please know that this outcome doesn't mean it won't work in the future. Many patients need more than one transfer. When you're ready, we'll sit down together and review what happened, and talk about what we can do differently next time. There's no rush - take all the time you need to process this.
call_to_action: For now, please take care of yourself. Reach out to our counselor if you need emotional support. And if you experience heavy bleeding or severe pain when your period starts, please call us.
contact_info: [PAUSE] I'm here if you have questions now, or you can call me anytime at {{clinic_phone}}. I'm so sorry.

context: Based on your latest scan and blood work, we need to make an important change to your plan.
explanation: Your excellent response ({{follicle_count}} follicles, E2: {{e2_level}}) puts you at risk for OHSS (Ovarian Hyperstimulation Syndrome). OHSS causes bloating, pain, and in severe cases, hospitalization. To keep you safe, we're switching to a 'freeze-all' strategy - we'll retrieve your eggs, freeze all embryos, and do transfer in a future cycle when your body has recovered.
next_steps: Trigger shot tonight with {{trigger_type}} (different than planned). Retrieval on schedule. All embryos frozen. FET in 1-2 months.
reassurance: I know this feels like a setback, but frozen embryos actually have HIGHER success rates than fresh transfers! And your safety comes first. This decision gives you the best chance of a healthy pregnancy. ðŸ’š
call_to_action: Drink LOTS of water (3-4 liters/day), high-protein diet, NO strenuous activity. Call IMMEDIATELY if severe bloating/pain/vomiting.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, it's Dr. {{doctor_name}}. I need to talk to you about your latest scan results.
context: [EMPATHETIC TONE] Today's scan showed {{follicle_count}} follicles, which is fewer than we were hoping for at this point in your cycle.
explanation: With your current response, if we continue to retrieval, we'd likely get very few eggs - maybe {{estimated_eggs}} at most. The success rate with that number is quite low, and the cost of continuing doesn't justify the low chance of success. [PAUSE]
next_steps: [SPEAK CLEARLY] I recommend we stop the cycle now, let your ovaries rest, and try again with a different protocol that might work better for you. We can try higher medication doses, add growth hormone, or consider a different stimulation approach entirely.
reassurance: [EMPATHY] I know this is incredibly frustrating. You've been doing the injections, coming to appointments, and now it feels like it was all for nothing. But please know - poor response to one protocol doesn't mean you can't succeed. We've learned valuable information about how your body responds, and we'll use that to make a better plan. Many of my patients who had cancelled cycles went on to have successful pregnancies with adjusted protocols.
call_to_action: You can stop all medications tonight. Your period will come in the next few days. Once it does, call us, and we'll schedule a consultation to discuss the new plan. There's no rush - we'll go at your pace.
contact_info: [PAUSE] I'm really sorry we're in this position. Do you have questions for me right now? You can also reach me at {{clinic_phone}} anytime.

explanation: This is rare but happens. The most common causes are: (1) All eggs were immature despite looking mature, (2) Sperm viability/motility issue, or (3) Unexpected fertilization dysfunction.
next_steps: This cycle is not viable. But this is NOT the end. Before the next cycle, we need to do: (a) Sperm DNA fragmentation test, (b) Check {{partner_name}}'s hormone levels, (c) PVP (Physiological Plasma) testing.
reassurance: Fertilization failure in cycle 1 does NOT mean it will happen again. Many patients with total fertilization failure go on to success with protocol adjustments.
call_to_action: I'm scheduling an emergency counseling + planning session for you both.

next_steps: 1. Drink 2-3L electrolyte solution (ORS/Pedialyte) daily. 2. Wear compression stockings. 3. Sleep with elevated legs. 4. Weigh daily. 4. Come for bloodwork every 2 days.
reassurance: OHSS peaks at 5-7 days post-retrieval, then improves. You will be fine.

call_to_action: Let's discuss protocol changes for next cycle.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, it's Nurse {{nurse_name}}. How are you feeling after the procedure?
context: [GENTLE TONE] You're now in what we call the Two Week Wait - the time between IUI and your pregnancy test.
explanation: For the next 14 days, implantation may or may not happen - it's completely out of our hands now. [PAUSE] Your beta hCG test is scheduled for {{beta_date}}. During this time, you'll continue taking progesterone if prescribed. You may notice light spotting around Day 6-12 - that can be implantation bleeding, which is actually a good sign. [EMPATHY] But it's also normal to have no symptoms.

explanation: IUI success: 10-20% per cycle. After {{iui_attempts}} failures, cumulative odds dropping. IVF success: 40-60% per cycle (much higher!). IVF better if: Age >35, Low sperm count, Blocked tubes, Endometriosis, >3-4 failed IUIs. IUI cheaper (â‚¹15-20K) but lower success. IVF expensive (â‚¹1.5-2L) but higher success = fewer cycles needed.

greeting: {{patient_name}}, thank you for coming in. I wanted to have an honest conversation with you about next steps.
context: [EMPATHETIC] You've completed {{iui_attempts}} IUI cycles without success. I know that's been really hard.
explanation: [CLEAR] Let me explain the statistics. IUI has about a 10-20% success rate per cycle. After {{iui_attempts}} attempts, the cumulative odds of it working are actually declining. [PAUSE] IVF, on the other hand, has a 40-60% success rate per cycle depending on age and other factors. It's significantly higher. [HONEST] Now, IVF costs more - around â‚¹1.5-2 lakhs per cycle versus â‚¹15-20K for IUI. But if you need 6 IUI cycles to get the same chance as 2 IVF cycles, the math actually favors IVF in the long run.
next_steps: [OPTIONS] Here are your choices: First, you could try 1-2 more IUI cycles if you're under 35 and there are no other issues - some people do succeed on attempt 4 or 5. Second, you could move to IVF now, which is what I'd recommend if you're over 35, have low sperm parameters, or have tried IUI 3+ times. Third, you could take a break and decide later - there's no rush if you need time emotionally or financially.
reassurance: [EMPATHY] Failed IUIs absolutely do not mean you can't get pregnant. IVF gives us much more control - we can see the eggs, watch them fertilize, choose the best embryos, and place them directly in the uterus. Many patients who fail IUI succeed on their first or second IVF cycle. You're not a failure - sometimes the method just needs to be more aggressive.
call_to_action: I'd like to schedule an IVF consultation for you - no obligation, just to give you all the information about costs, timeline, and your specific success odds. Then you can make an informed decision. Does that sound okay?
contact_info: Think it over and call me at {{clinic_phone}} when you're ready to talk more.

context: After {{failed_transfers}} failed transfers with good embryos, we need to investigate why.
explanation: ERA (Endometrial Receptivity Analysis) test tells us your exact 'implantation window' - when your lining is most receptive. 30% of women have a displaced window (need progesterone for more/less time before transfer). This could explain the failures.
next_steps: Mock FET cycle: Take estrogen + progesterone as normal. On 'transfer day,' we do endometrial biopsy instead (5 min, mild cramping). Lab analyzes 238 genes. Results in 3 weeks tell us if we need to adjust progesterone timing.
reassurance: ERA has helped many patients with repeated failures finally succeed - it's like finding the missing puzzle piece! Cost ~â‚¹30-40K but could save future transfers. ðŸ”¬
call_to_action: Think it over, discuss with partner. Not urgent but worth considering before next FET. Schedule when ready.

context: Your body has recovered from the fresh cycle. Time for FET!
explanation: FET advantages over fresh: 1) No ovarian stimulation = no OHSS risk, 2) Your body is rested and balanced, 3) Frozen embryos have been 'tested by time' (weak ones don't survive freezing), 4) Success rates often HIGHER than fresh! You have {{frozen_embryo_count}} frozen embryos.
next_steps: Start period Day 1 call. Day 2-3 baseline scan. Then {{protocol_type}} protocol: Medicated (estrogen pills/patches) OR Natural (monitor ovulation). Transfer 2-3 weeks later.
reassurance: The failed fresh cycle taught us valuable info about your response. FET is a fresh start with better odds! Many patients succeed on FET after fresh fails. Stay hopeful! ðŸŒˆ
call_to_action: Rest this month or start next period? Your choice. When ready, call on Day 1 and we'll begin!

context: Aaj se estrogen start ho raha hai.
explanation: Aap {{estrogen_type}} logi - {{estrogen_dose}} {{route}}. Estrogen aapki uterine lining ko thick aur fluffy banata hai (jaise pillow) taaki embryo chipak sake. Target: 7-12mm lining.
next_steps: {{schedule}} - Pills: 2mg twice daily with food / Patches: Change every 3 days / Injections: Every 3 days. Pehli lining check Day {{check_day}} ko.
reassurance: Estrogen natural hormone hai - pregnant women mein bhi hota hai. Side effects mild: breast tenderness, mood swings, headache. Sab normal! ðŸ’Š
call_to_action: Aaj se start karo. Same time daily. Calendar pe mark karo. Next scan {{scan_date}} ko.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, it's Nurse {{nurse_name}} with your scan results!
context: [EXCITED TONE] Great news - your lining looks absolutely perfect for transfer!
explanation: Today's scan showed {{lining_thickness}}mm with a beautiful trilaminar pattern - that's the three-layer look we want. It's like a perfect mattress for the embryo. Your estrogen level is {{e2_level}}, which is right where we want it.
next_steps: [SPEAK SLOWLY] Here's the plan: You'll start progesterone {{progesterone_type}} on {{start_date}}. {{administration_details}}. Your transfer is scheduled for {{transfer_date}} at {{transfer_time}} - that's {{transfer_days}} days after starting progesterone.
reassurance: This is the moment we've been building toward with all the estrogen! Your lining is textbook perfect. The embryo is going to have a wonderful home.
call_to_action: [CLEAR INSTRUCTIONS] Do you have the progesterone ready? {{specific_instructions}}. And remember - once you start progesterone, timing is critical. Don't miss any doses. Set reminders on your phone if needed.
contact_info: Any questions about the progesterone administration? We can have you come in for the first injection if you want to see how it's done. Call us at {{clinic_phone}}.

eventName: All Frozen Embryos Used - Last FET
greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, it's Dr. {{doctor_name}}. I wanted to talk with you before this transfer.
context: [EMPATHETIC] This is your last frozen embryo from the original retrieval cycle.
explanation: You have one {{stage}} embryo - Grade {{grade}} - remaining in storage. This is it from that cohort. I want to make sure you understand what it means: if this transfer doesn't work, you'll need to do another egg retrieval to get more embryos.
next_steps: The transfer will proceed as usual on {{transfer_date}}. Everything is optimized for success. But I want you to be mentally prepared for both outcomes: pregnancy, or the need for another retrieval cycle.
reassurance: [PAUSE] It only takes one embryo to make a baby. This embryo has already proven itself by surviving freezing and thawing. Grade {{grade}} has a {{success_rate}}% success rate. I'm hopeful, and I want you to stay hopeful too. But if it doesn't work, we'll make a plan together for next steps.
call_to_action: For now, focus on this transfer. Stay positive but realistic. After the transfer, we'll do everything to support a healthy pregnancy. If it doesn't work, take time to grieve, then we'll talk about what's next - maybe retrieving again, maybe donor eggs, whatever feels right for you.
contact_info: I'm here for you either way. Questions now? You can reach me anytime at {{clinic_phone}}.

eventName: FET Conversion to Fresh - Spontaneous Ovulation
context: You ovulated spontaneously during FET prep.
explanation: Today's scan shows you already ovulated (ruptured follicle visible) even though we were trying to suppress ovulation. Your LH: {{lh_level}} (surged). This throws off our timing - we can't predict exact progesterone days now.
next_steps: CANCEL this FET cycle. Stop all meds. Period will come in ~2 weeks. Next cycle, we'll use stronger suppression (birth control pills OR GnRH agonist) to prevent this.
reassurance: This is frustrating but actually good - means you ovulate strongly! Just need better control. Some clinics actually prefer natural ovulation (modified natural FET). We'll adjust! ðŸ”„
call_to_action: Stop estrogen today. Rest this month. Call on Day 1 of next period to start again with adjusted protocol.

context: Today's scan showed a polyp in your uterus.
explanation: There's a {{polyp_size}}mm endometrial polyp (benign growth) at {{polyp_location}}. Polyps can interfere with implantation - they act like an IUD, preventing embryo attachment. We need to remove it before FET.
next_steps: Hysteroscopy scheduled {{surgery_date}} (5-10 min procedure, local/light sedation). Remove polyp, biopsy lining. Recovery: 1-2 days. Wait one period after surgery, then FET in {{timeline}}.
reassurance: Polyps are super common (10-20% of women). Removal is simple and increases success rates! Good we found it before wasting an embryo! ðŸ”¬
call_to_action: Stop FET meds. Do hysteroscopy. This delay will IMPROVE your chances, not hurt them. Silver lining!

explanation: We transferred {{embryos_transferred}} embryos, and BOTH implanted! Two gestational sacs visible, both with heartbeats at {{heartbeat1_rate}} and {{heartbeat2_rate}} bpm. Fraternal twins (two separate embryos)!
next_steps: Continue all meds. Twins = higher risk pregnancy - more monitoring needed. OB referral NOW (not 12 weeks). Early ultrasounds every 2 weeks. Expect higher pregnancy symptoms (nausea, fatigue).
reassurance: Twins are exciting and come with challenges! You'll need more rest, better nutrition, high-risk OB care. But thousands of women carry twins successfully! We'll support you closely! ðŸŽ‰
call_to_action: Increase protein (100g/day), hydrate more, REST MORE. No heavy activity. Report any bleeding/severe pain immediately. Next scan {{next_scan}}.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, it's Dr. {{doctor_name}}. How are you feeling?
context: [GENTLE] I know the miscarriage was heartbreaking. I wanted to check in and see if you're ready to talk about trying again.
explanation: [EMPATHY] Physically, your body has recovered - it's been {{months_since_loss}} months since your loss. Hormonally, everything is back to normal. Your lining looks healthy on the scan. Medically, you're ready for another FET. But the bigger question is: are YOU ready emotionally?
next_steps: [NO PRESSURE] There's no rush. Some patients want to try immediately - it helps them feel hopeful again. Others need 6 months or a year to heal emotionally. Both are completely valid. When you're ready, we'll do another FET with the same protocol or adjust if you want.
reassurance: [PAUSE] Miscarriage after IVF is devastating because you've already invested so much. But please know - having a positive pregnancy, even if it ended in loss, means your embryos CAN implant and your body CAN get pregnant. That's actually a good sign for future attempts. Many patients who miscarry go on to have successful pregnancies next time.
call_to_action: Take all the time you need. There's no expiration date on your frozen embryos. They'll wait for you. If you want counseling support, we have resources. When you're ready, just call and we'll start the FET prep.
contact_info: I'm thinking of you. Reach out anytime - {{clinic_phone}}. No pressure.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}! Welcome to egg freezing journey ðŸ¥šâ„ï¸
context: You're considering freezing your eggs - smart decision!
explanation: Egg freezing preserves YOUR eggs at current age/quality for future use. Best before age 35 (egg quality peaks). Process: Stimulation (10-14 days) â†’ Retrieval â†’ Freeze. Use them later for IVF when you're ready for baby. No expiration date!
next_steps: {{plan}} - AMH + baseline scan to assess reserve â†’ Stimulation protocol design â†’ Financial planning (â‚¹1.5-2L per cycle) â†’ Timeline discussion
reassurance: Freezing eggs = buying time without compromising fertility! Whether for career, health, or not finding partner yet - you're taking control of your future. Empowering! ðŸ’ª
call_to_action: Schedule AMH test + scan on Day 2-3 of next period. Bring partner/family to next consult if helpful. Questions? WhatsApp anytime!

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, thank you for coming in to discuss egg freezing.
context: Let me walk you through what egg freezing entails and whether it's right for you.
explanation: [CLEAR EXPLANATION] Egg freezing is essentially the first half of IVF - we stimulate your ovaries with hormones to grow multiple eggs, retrieve them through a minor procedure, and then freeze them using a flash-freezing technique called vitrification. The eggs stay frozen indefinitely - 10 years, 20 years, as long as needed. When you're ready to have a baby, we thaw the eggs, fertilize them with sperm, grow embryos, and transfer one to your uterus. [PAUSE] The key is to freeze eggs while you're young - ideally under 35 - because egg quality declines with age. If you freeze at 32 and use them at 40, those are still 32-year-old eggs, not 40-year-old eggs.
next_steps: Here's what we need to do next: First, blood test for AMH to check your ovarian reserve - how many eggs you have. Second, a baseline ultrasound to count your follicles. This tells us how many eggs we might get per cycle. Based on your age {{patient_age}}, I'd recommend freezing {{recommended_egg_count}} eggs total for a good chance of future pregnancy. That might mean {{cycle_count}} retrieval cycles.
reassurance: [EMPATHY] I know this feels like a big decision - you're planning for a future baby that might not exist yet. But many of my patients say freezing eggs gave them peace of mind. It removes the biological clock pressure. You can focus on career, travel, finding the right partner - whatever you need - knowing your fertility is preserved.
call_to_action: Think it over, discuss with family if that helps. No rush on the decision, but the sooner you freeze, the better the egg quality. When you're ready, we'll schedule the AMH test and get started.
contact_info: Any questions for me now? [WAIT] You can reach me at {{clinic_phone}} anytime.

eventName: AMH Result - Good Reserve for Egg Freezing
context: Your AMH is {{amh_value}} ng/mL - great reserve for your age!
explanation: At age {{patient_age}}, AMH {{amh_value}} means you have good egg quantity. Expected retrieval: {{estimated_eggs}} eggs per cycle. For optimal future success, aim to freeze {{target_egg_count}} eggs total = {{cycle_count}} cycle(s).
next_steps: Baseline scan Day 2-3 of next period â†’ Start stimulation Day 2 â†’ Retrieval ~Day 13 â†’ Freeze â†’ Repeat if needed for second cycle
reassurance: Your numbers look great! You're in an excellent position to bank enough eggs for future. Starting soon maximizes quality while you're young! â°
call_to_action: Call on Day 1 of next period. We'll schedule baseline scan. Financial counseling available for multi-cycle packages (discounts!).

eventName: AMH Result - Low Reserve for Egg Freezing
greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, it's Dr. {{doctor_name}}. I have your AMH results.
context: [GENTLE TONE] Your AMH came back at {{amh_value}}, which is lower than we'd like for your age.
explanation: [HONEST] AMH below 1.0 means diminished ovarian reserve - fewer eggs remaining. For egg freezing, this presents a challenge. In one cycle, we might only retrieve {{estimated_eggs}} eggs, and not all will be mature. To bank a reasonable number like {{target_egg_count}} eggs, you'd likely need {{cycle_count}} cycles, which gets expensive. [PAUSE]

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}} and {{partner_name}}, thank you for coming in today.
context: [EMPATHETIC] I know we've been trying with your own eggs, and this conversation about donor eggs might feel like a defeat. I want you to know it's not.
explanation: [CLEAR] Donor eggs means using eggs from another woman - either someone you know or an anonymous donor - fertilizing them with {{partner_name}}'s sperm, and transferring the embryos to {{patient_name}}'s uterus. {{patient_name}}, YOU would carry the pregnancy, give birth, and nurse the baby. The baby would have {{partner_name}}'s genetics and the donor's genetics, but not yours genetically. [PAUSE] However, and this is important - recent research shows that even though the baby doesn't have your DNA, your body DOES influence which genes get turned on or off through something called epigenetics. You're not just an incubator - your body shapes the baby's development.
next_steps:
[OPTIONS] You have three donor options: 
1) Known donor - maybe your sister or a friend. Advantage: you know medical history and can tell your child about the donor. Disadvantage: complicated legal/emotional dynamics. 
2) Anonymous donor from an egg bank - pre-frozen eggs, quick process, choose based on profile photos/info. Advantage: fast, less expensive. Disadvantage: limited egg supply per donor. 
3) Fresh donor cycle - we recruit a donor who does full IVF cycle for you. Advantage: more eggs, better quality. Disadvantage: expensive, 6-month timeline, legal contracts.
reassurance: [EMPATHY] I know this is a huge emotional shift. Many patients grieve the loss of their genetic connection to their child. That's completely normal and valid. Take time to process. Talk to a counselor. But I also want to tell you - I've had hundreds of patients use donor eggs, and NOT ONE has ever told me they regret it or love their child any less. The desire to be a mother is so much deeper than genetics. When you're sleep-deprived at 3am with a crying baby, genetics won't matter - it will just be YOUR baby.
call_to_action: Don't decide today. Take weeks or months to think about it. Read stories from donor egg parents. Talk to our counselor. When you're ready, we'll discuss next steps. There's no pressure.
contact_info: I'm here to support whatever decision you make. Call me at {{clinic_phone}} anytime.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, {{donor_name}}, and {{partner_name}}. Thank you all for coming in.
context: [SERIOUS TONE] Using a known donor - especially a family member - requires careful legal and emotional planning.
explanation: [CLEAR] When {{donor_name}} donates eggs to {{patient_name}}, there are complex legal issues: Who is the legal mother? What if {{donor_name}} wants involvement in the child's life later? What if relationships sour? Can the child contact {{donor_name}} when they're 18? [PAUSE] Unlike anonymous donation, known donation creates ongoing relationships that need boundaries. I REQUIRE all parties to see a reproductive attorney AND a counselor BEFORE we proceed. This protects everyone - especially the future child.
next_steps: [REQUIREMENTS] 1) Legal contract drafted by reproductive attorney (not regular lawyer) - defines parental rights, future contact, financial agreements. 2) Psychological evaluation for {{donor_name}} - ensures she's donating freely without coercion. 3) Counseling session for all parties together - discuss future scenarios, boundaries, child disclosure. 4) Medical screening for {{donor_name}} - genetic testing, infectious disease, psych clearance. Timeline: 2-3 months for all clearances.
reassurance: [EMPATHY] I know this seems overly formal when it's family. But I've seen known donor situations go wrong when boundaries weren't clear. The legal contract protects your family relationships AND the child's best interests. It's worth the extra time and cost.
call_to_action: Here are referrals for attorney and counselor who specialize in known donor cases. Complete those steps, then we'll proceed with medical screening. No rushing - get it right.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, it's Dr. {{doctor_name}}. I wanted to talk about the recent failed transfer.
context: [EMPATHETIC] This was your {{transfer_number}} transfer with donor eggs, and it didn't work again.
explanation: [HONEST] Donor eggs have high success rates - 60-70% per transfer for young donor eggs. After {{transfer_number}} failures, we need to investigate YOUR side - your uterus. The embryos are likely fine (young eggs, good embryos), so the issue is probably implantation. Possible causes: Uterine polyps/fibroids we missed, adenomyosis, chronic endometritis (infection), immunological issues, thin lining, or displaced implantation window (ERA test).
next_steps: [TESTING PLAN] Before using more donor embryos, I recommend: 1) Hysteroscopy - look inside uterus for polyps/scarring. 2) Endometrial biopsy - test for chronic endometritis (treatable with antibiotics). 3) ERA test - check if we're transferring at the right time (maybe need more/less progesterone). 4) Immunology panel - test for blood clotting issues, autoimmune factors. 5) Maybe mock cycle with immunology protocol (steroids, blood thinners) before next real transfer.
reassurance: [EMPATHY] I know this is devastating - you thought donor eggs would be the answer, and they haven't been yet. But please don't give up. We WILL figure out what's preventing implantation. Most of these issues are fixable. Once we identify and treat the problem, the next transfer could work.
call_to_action: Let's schedule the testing. It will take 4-6 weeks to get answers. Then we'll do a mock cycle with treatment protocol. Don't transfer another embryo until we've investigated fully - let's not waste precious embryos.
contact_info: I'm so sorry you're going through this. Let's solve it together. {{clinic_phone}}.

greeting: {{patient_name}} and {{partner_name}}, I understand you have cultural concerns about donor eggs.
context: [RESPECTFUL TONE] Many cultures and religions have specific views on third-party reproduction.
explanation: [SENSITIVE] Some religions permit egg donation, others don't. Some require anonymous donors, others prefer known. Some allow the husband's sperm but not donor eggs, or vice versa. [PAUSE] I'm not a religious authority - I can't tell you what's 'allowed' in your faith. But I can tell you that many patients from conservative backgrounds have navigated this by consulting with progressive religious scholars, seeking fatwas or rabbinic opinions, or deciding that family-building is a personal medical decision between you and God. What I can say medically: donor eggs allow YOU to carry the pregnancy, birth the baby, and raise the child - you ARE the mother in every meaningful way.
next_steps: [SUGGESTIONS] Consider: 1) Consult religious leader you trust for guidance. 2) Seek out scholars who have written about ART in your faith. 3) Join support groups for people of your background who used donor eggs - learn how they reconciled it. 4) Decide whether this is a religious issue or cultural family pressure issue - those are different. 5) Weigh the alternative - remaining childless - against using donor eggs.
reassurance: [EMPATHY] I've had patients from every religious background successfully use donor eggs and feel at peace with it spiritually. Others decided it violated their beliefs and chose adoption instead. Both are valid. This is a deeply personal decision that only you two can make.
call_to_action: Take time to explore your values, talk to religious advisors, pray/meditate on it. If you decide donor eggs are okay for you, we're here. If not, I'll support you in other paths like adoption.
contact_info: Interfaith counselor referral available if helpful: {{counselor_phone}}

explanation: Aapke eggs kam hain, isliye hum 'Pool' karenge. Matlab 2-3 baar eggs nikal kar ikattha karenge.
next_steps: Transfer baad mein.
reassurance: Boond boond se sagar banta hai.

explanation: The embryos are fragmented and slow growing. This is typical of age-related cytoplasmic decline.
next_steps: We can try adding 'Growth Hormone' (Omnitrope) injections during next stimulation to improve egg quality.
reassurance: Sometimes the adjuvant therapy makes the difference.

explanation: Your FSH is >25 and periods are irregular. You are in 'Perimenopause'.
next_steps: The window is closing fast. We cannot wait.
reassurance: We need to catch an ovulation before it stops completely.

explanation: Start DHEA 25mg (3x daily) and CoQ10 600mg.
next_steps: Must take for 6 weeks BEFORE stimulation starts.
reassurance: This 'rejuvenates' the sleeping follicles.

explanation: DHEA aur CoQ10 shuru karein. Ye eggs ki energy badhate hain.
next_steps: Kam se kam 1.5 mahina khana hai.
reassurance: Wait karna padega.

explanation: Dr prescribed Testosterone Gel application for 21 days.
next_steps: Apply on thighs. This increases FSH receptors on follicles.
reassurance: Helps recruit more eggs in low responders.

explanation: We have no Euploid, but one 'Low Level Mosaic'. At age 42, this is precious.
next_steps: I recommend transferring it. The chances are lower but not zero.
reassurance: Better than cancelling.

explanation: At age 40+, we prefer 'Freeze All' and PGT-A. Fresh transfers have high miscarriage rates.
next_steps: Freeze embryos -> Biopsy -> Transfer Normal.
reassurance: Avoids the trauma of miscarriage.

explanation: Goal: Bank 6-8 embryos before testing.
next_steps: It saves biopsy cost (batch testing) and time.
reassurance: Efficient strategy.

explanation: Abhi transfer nahi karenge. Pehle kuch embryos bank kar lete hain.
next_steps: Ek aur cycle karenge.
reassurance: Backup hona zaroori hai.

explanation: We saw follicles but got no eggs. In older ovaries, follicles can sometimes be empty cysts.
next_steps: It's a sign of ovarian aging.
reassurance: We can try flushing next time, but prognosis is guarded.

explanation: High dose meds aren't working. Let's try 'Natural Cycle IVF' - catch the one natural egg.
next_steps: Better quality often found in natural selection.
reassurance: Less drugs, less cost, focus on quality.

explanation: Using 'Zymot Chip' for sperm selection today.
next_steps: Mimics natural barriers to select best DNA sperm.
reassurance: Helps with older eggs.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}! Dr. {{doctor_name}} here regarding your IVF plan. ðŸ§¬
context: Hume decide karna hai ki is cycle mein PGT-A (Genetic Testing) karna hai ya nahi.
explanation: PGT-A mein hum embryo se kuch cells lekar check karte hain ki chromosomes normal (46) hain ya nahi. Iska cost approx â‚¹15-20k per embryo hota hai. Ye unke liye best hai jinki age 35+ hai ya pehle miscarriages huye hain.
next_steps: Agar hum ye test karte hain, toh miscarriage ka risk kam ho jata hai aur success rate 10-15% badh jata hai.
reassurance: Isse hum 'blind' transfer nahi karte, balki sirf best quality embryo choose karte hain. Long term mein ye time aur paisa dono bacha sakta hai.
call_to_action: Please discuss with {{partner_name}} and let us know your decision by tomorrow so we can prepare the lab.

greeting: Hello {{patient_name}}, this is Dr. {{doctor_name}}. Do you have a moment to discuss the genetic testing option?
context: Before we finalize your stimulation protocol, we need to decide on Preimplantation Genetic Testing for Aneuploidy (PGT-A).
explanation: In a standard IVF cycle, we choose embryos based on how they look under a microscope. PGT-A allows us to look at the genetics inside. We biopsy 5-7 cells from the outer layer of the blastocyst on Day 5. We freeze the embryos while waiting for results.
next_steps: The benefit is a higher implantation rate per transfer (up to 60-70%) and a significantly lower miscarriage rate, as most miscarriages are due to chromosomal errors.
reassurance: While it is an additional cost upfront, it often prevents the emotional and financial cost of failed transfers or miscarriages later. Given your history, I strongly recommend considering it.
call_to_action: Do you have any specific worries about the biopsy process I can answer right now?

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, update from the embryology lab! ðŸ”¬
context: Your embryos have reached Day 5/6 Blastocyst stage and are ready for biopsy.
explanation: Our senior embryologist will carefully remove 5-7 cells from the trophectoderm (the part that becomes the placenta). The inner cell mass (baby part) is NOT touched. The embryos will be frozen immediately after.
next_steps: The sample cells are sent to the genetics lab. Results usually take 14-21 days.
reassurance: The risk of damage to the embryo during biopsy is very low (<1%) in our lab. They handle the freezing process very well.
call_to_action: Rest easy! We will notify you as soon as the genetic report arrives.

greeting: Hello {{patient_name}}, calling with a lab update.
context: Today is Day 5, and we are performing the biopsy on your blastocysts.
explanation: We have {{follicle_count}} embryos that have expanded beautifully. We are using a laser to gently separate a few cells for the PGT-A test. This is done at the blastocyst stage because the embryo is robust enough to handle it.
next_steps: Once biopsied, they are vitrified (flash frozen). They stop developing now and will resume exactly where they left off when we thaw them for transfer.
reassurance: The embryos look high quality, graded {{embryo_grade}}, which makes them excellent candidates for this procedure.
call_to_action: We will send the final count of biopsied embryos via WhatsApp by this evening.

context: [WARM TONE] I am calling with the best possible news regarding your PGT-A results.
explanation: The report just came in: ALL {{embryo_count}} embryos tested are Euploid (Normal)! This is a fantastic outcome, better than statistical averages for your age.
next_steps: We can now schedule your Frozen Embryo Transfer (FET) with high confidence. We will select the single best graded Euploid for transfer.
reassurance: This confirms that despite the journey to get here, your egg quality is excellent. Implantation chance is now 60-70%.
call_to_action: Let's plan to start the lining preparation with your next period. Congratulations to you and {{partner_name}}!

context: Aapka genetic testing (PGT-A) report aa gaya hai.
explanation: Sabhi {{embryo_count}} embryos 'Euploid' (NORMAL) hain! ðŸŒŸ Matlab unme 46 chromosomes hain aur wo bilkul healthy hain.
next_steps: Ab hum confident hokar transfer plan kar sakte hain. Aapke period ke Day 2 par hume call karein.
reassurance: Is result se pregnancy ke chances maximum ho gaye hain aur miscarriage ka risk almost khatam. Bohot accha result hai!
call_to_action: Aaj celebrate karein! ðŸ° Hum jald hi treatment calendar bhejenge.

context: We have received your PGT-A genetic results from the reference lab.
explanation: The results are unfortunately not what we hoped for. The embryos tested as 'Aneuploid' (abnormal chromosome count).
next_steps: I would like to discuss the detailed report with you personally to explain the specific errors found and what this means for our next steps.
reassurance: Please know this is a reflection of the biology of this specific cycle, not a permanent door closed. We can adjust protocols.
call_to_action: Are you available for a Zoom call or clinic visit tomorrow at 11 AM?

context: [GENTLE TONE] Maine abhi aapka PGT-A report dekha, aur news thodi difficult hai.
explanation: Report ke hisaab se sabhi embryos mein chromosomal abnormalities aayi hain. [PAUSE] Matlab nature ne unhe select nahi kiya aage badhne ke liye. Agar hum inhe transfer karte, toh miscarriage hota.
next_steps: Hume samajhna hoga ki ye egg quality ki wajah se hua ya sperm factor se. Main chahta hoon aap clinic aayein taaki hum agla plan bana sakein.
reassurance: [EMPATHY] Main samajh sakta hoon ye sunna kitna mushkil hai. Par achhi baat ye hai ki humne 'blind transfer' karke aapko emotional trauma se bacha liya. Ab hume pata hai ki hume kya fix karna hai.
call_to_action: Aap kab aa sakte hain milne? Take your time.

context: The genetic report is in for your {{total_eggs}} biopsied embryos.
explanation: Good news: We have {{embryo_count}} NORMAL (Euploid) embryo(s) ready for transfer! ðŸŒŸ (Note: Some other embryos were abnormal, which is very common and expected).
next_steps: We will prioritize the best graded Normal embryo for your transfer. The abnormal ones will be discarded as per protocol.
reassurance: Having even one Euploid embryo gives us a fantastic chance at a healthy pregnancy. This is a win!
call_to_action: Let us know when your next period starts to plan the transfer.

greeting: Hello {{patient_name}}, this is Dr. {{doctor_name}} with your results.
context: I have the PGT-A report. It is a mixed result, which is very typical for IVF.
explanation: Out of the batch, {{embryo_count}} embryos are Euploid (Normal) and safe to transfer. The others had chromosomal errors. We have identified the 'Golden Embryo' to transfer first.
next_steps: We will keep the normal embryos in storage. We do not need to do anything with the abnormal ones right now.
reassurance: This saves us time by ensuring we don't transfer the embryos that wouldn't have worked. We are focusing strictly on the healthy ones.
call_to_action: We are ready to move to the transfer phase whenever you are.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, Dr. {{doctor_name}} here regarding the report. ðŸ§¬
context: One of your embryos came back as 'Mosaic'.
explanation: Mosaic means the biopsy showed a mix of normal and abnormal cells. It's not perfectly normal, but not fully abnormal either. These embryos CAN result in healthy babies, though the success rate is slightly lower (30-40%).
next_steps: We usually keep Mosaic embryos as a backup option after all Euploid embryos are used. Genetic counseling is recommended before transferring.
reassurance: Recent studies show many Mosaic embryos 'self-correct' in the uterus. It is definitely worth keeping!
call_to_action: We will mark this as 'Store - Potential Transfer'. No action needed from you now.

greeting: Hello {{patient_name}}, I want to explain a specific finding in your report.
context: We found a 'Mosaic' embryo. This is a grey area in genetics.
explanation: A Mosaic result means the sample had say, 60% normal cells and 40% abnormal. In the past, we discarded these, but science has advanced. We now know these can lead to healthy births.
next_steps: We have three options: 1. Keep as backup. 2. Discard. 3. Donate to research. My recommendation is to keep it as a backup.
reassurance: Don't worry, we would never transfer this without a detailed discussion and ensuring we have exhausted better options first.
call_to_action: Think about it and let us know your consent on the storage form.

greeting: Hello {{patient_name}}, regarding your question about the PGT-A report.
context: [PROFESSIONAL/FIRM] You asked if the report will show the gender of the embryos.
explanation: I must clarify that in India, under the PCPNDT Act, sex selection or disclosure of fetal gender is strictly illegal and a punishable offense. The PGT-A report we receive has the sex chromosomes masked (hidden).
next_steps: We look purely at genetic health (Euploidy), not gender. We will transfer the healthiest embryo regardless of sex.
reassurance: Our goal is a healthy baby. The genetic testing ensures the baby is free from chromosomal disorders, which is the most important factor.
call_to_action: I hope you understand our strict adherence to the law. Do you have questions about the *health* aspects of the report?

context: Just a gentle reminder regarding our discussion on PGT-A results.
explanation: Please note: In compliance with Indian Law (PCPNDT Act), our clinic does NOT disclose the sex of embryos under any circumstance. PGT-A is strictly for medical/genetic health checking.
next_steps: We will select the embryo with the highest 'Grading' (e.g., 5AA) and 'Euploid' status for transfer.
reassurance: We are committed to helping you have a healthy, happy baby! ðŸ‘¶
call_to_action: Thank you for cooperating with our legal policies.

context: Since we have PGT-A tested Euploid embryos, we recommend a 'Single Embryo Transfer' (SET).
explanation: A single Euploid embryo has a very high success rate (>60%). Transferring two increases the risk of twins, which are high-risk pregnancies (preterm labor, NICU needs).
next_steps: We will transfer ONE high-grade embryo. If you have others, they remain safe in the freezer.
reassurance: Transferring one by one gives you the highest cumulative chance of a healthy baby without the complications of a multiple pregnancy.
call_to_action: Please confirm you are okay with the Single Transfer strategy.

context: I want to explain why I am insisting on transferring only one embryo this time.
explanation: Because we used PGT-A, we know this embryo is genetically potent. If we put two back, there is a 40-50% chance of twins. While twins seem cute, they come with high medical risks for you and the babies.
next_steps: We transfer one. If it doesn't work (God forbid), we have the second one ready for next month. This gives us two chances at success rather than risking everything on one go.
reassurance: Trust the quality of the embryo. One good embryo is all it takes.
call_to_action: Are you comfortable proceeding with a single transfer?

context: [EMPATHY/PAUSE] We spoke about the results yesterday, and I know you are hurting.
explanation: Having zero euploid embryos is a difficult diagnostic finding. It suggests that the issue is likely egg quality related to age or genetics, which IVF alone cannot fix.
next_steps: We have two paths: 1. Try one more cycle with a different protocol (Growth Hormone, Dual Stim) to see if we can find that one golden egg. 2. Consider Donor Eggs, which would give us an immediate jump to 60-70% success.
reassurance: Please remember, you can carry a pregnancy perfectly fineâ€”your uterus is great. The issue is just the 'seed'.
call_to_action: Take a week to think. I am here to guide you whichever path you choose.

context: Following up on our conversation regarding the PGT-A results.
explanation: I know this is a heavy time. The results showed us the biological hurdle we are facing. It is not your fault.
next_steps: When you are ready, I want to review the 'Donor Egg' option vs. 'New Protocol' option with you and {{partner_name}}. There are pros and cons to both.
reassurance: We have handled many cases like this that eventually resulted in a baby. We just need to change the strategy.
call_to_action: Let me know when you feel ready to schedule a follow-up consult. No rush.

explanation: PGT-A adds approx â‚¹15-20k per embryo. However, it increases success rates and reduces miscarriage risk significantly.
next_steps: Highly recommended for age 35+. Discuss with Dr if needed.
reassurance: Investing now can save cost of failed transfers later.
call_to_action: Reply YES to include PGT-A, NO to opt out.

context: You asked if PGT-A is worth the extra money.
explanation: Let's look at the math: Each frozen transfer cost you about â‚¹50k + meds. If we transfer an abnormal embryo, that money is wasted, plus the emotional cost of a negative result. PGT-A costs â‚¹20k per embryo but ensures we only transfer the ones that can work.
next_steps: If we have 4 embryos, testing costs â‚¹80k. But it might save you 2-3 failed transfer cycles (saving â‚¹1.5L).
reassurance: From a financial and emotional efficiency standpoint, PGT-A usually pays for itself by shortening the time to pregnancy.
call_to_action: Does that breakdown make sense to you?

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, Urgent message from Dr. {{doctor_name}}. ðŸš¨
context: Based on your symptoms (breathlessness/vomiting), admission is required.
explanation: You need IV fluids and protein support to manage the OHSS. This is the safest place for you right now.
next_steps:
**Pack a bag:** Toiletries, phone charger, loose clothes. 
**Hospital:** {{hospital_name}} Admission Desk. 
**Duration:** Likely 2-4 days.
reassurance: We catch this early, it resolves quickly. Your embryos are safe in the lab! Focus on getting better.
call_to_action: Please leave for the hospital now. Message us when you reach.

context: OHSS symptoms severe hain. Hospital admission zaroori hai.
explanation: IV fluids aur monitoring chahiye taaki complication na ho.
next_steps: {{hospital_name}} emergency mein report karein immediately.
reassurance: Dr ne baat kar li hai wahan. Aap safe rahenge.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, hoping you feel a bit better! ðŸŒ¸
explanation: Day 1-3 are usually the peak of bloating. By Day 5-7 (post-trigger), you will start peeing more - this is the sign of recovery! The fluid will reabsorb naturally.
next_steps: Target: 3-4 Liters of fluid/ORS daily. High protein diet (Paneer/Eggs/Chicken/Protein shake).
reassurance: It feels uncomfortable now, but it is self-limiting. It WILL go away. This indicates you had a very strong response to meds (lots of eggs!).
call_to_action: Track your weight and urine output daily. Send us a photo of the chart at 6 PM.

context: You are going home today after OHSS management.
explanation: You are stable, but not 100% yet. The ovaries are still large. You must NOT do heavy activity or sudden twisting movements (risk of ovarian torsion).
next_steps: Continue high protein diet at home. If vomiting returns or you cannot pass urine for 6 hours, come back to ER.
reassurance: Your period will start in a few days, and that will completely resolve the bloating. The worst is over.
call_to_action: Call us Day 1 of your period. Take care.

context: [SERIOUS/GENTLE] I need to discuss the retrieval results.
explanation: Despite seeing follicles on scan, we could not retrieve eggs. This is 'Empty Follicle Syndrome'. It happens in 1-2% of cases. It usually means the final trigger shot didn't release the eggs from the wall, or there was an absorption issue.
next_steps: We will not proceed with transfer. For the next cycle, we will change the trigger to 'Dual Trigger' (Lupron + HCG) and check your blood levels the next morning to GUARANTEE absorption.
reassurance: This does NOT mean you have no eggs left. It is a technical/medication failure, not a biological failure. We can fix the protocol.
call_to_action: Rest today. Let's meet next week to plan the corrective protocol.

explanation: Dr. {{doctor_name}} needs to discuss the findings with you personally.
next_steps: Please do not worry, but we need to explain the outcome.
reassurance: We have a plan for this situation.
call_to_action: Please call the doctor's direct line when you wake up.

context: Following up on your call with the doctor regarding the fertilization results.
explanation: I know the news about 'Zero Fertilization' was shocking. As Dr. explained, it's likely an egg activation issue.
next_steps: We have scheduled a counseling session for you on {{next_consult_date}} to discuss 'Calcium Ionophore' usage for the next round.
reassurance: This is a diagnostic hurdle. We now know exactly what went wrong and have tools to fix it. Don't lose hope! ðŸ’š

context: Kal ke results ke baad main bas check-in kar rahi thi.
explanation: Zero embryos banna bohot rare hai, par iska solution hai. Next time hum 'ICSI + Activation' use karenge.
next_steps: Abhi body ko rest do. Period aane ka wait karo.
reassurance: Ek failure ka matlab ye nahi ki aap parents nahi ban sakte. Hum protocol change karke dubara try karenge.
call_to_action: Hum aapke saath hain. Call anytime if you feel low.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, lab update regarding your embryos. ðŸ”¬
context: We have been monitoring the development from Day 3 to Day 5.
explanation: Unfortunately, the embryos have 'arrested' (stopped growing) at the cellular stage and did not form Blastocysts. We cannot perform the transfer.
next_steps: This often indicates a sperm DNA issue or egg quality factor. We need to stop meds and wait for your period.
reassurance: It is better that they stopped now than causing a miscarriage later. Nature has a quality control mechanism.
call_to_action: Dr. {{doctor_name}} wants to review the sperm DNA fragmentation test. Please book a consult.

context: [GENTLE/PAUSE] I have the final culture report, and I'm afraid we won't be doing a transfer tomorrow.
explanation: Your embryos grew to Day 3 but failed to make the jump to Day 5 Blastocysts. This is called 'Embryo Arrest'. It suggests the genetic engine of the embryo ran out of energy.
next_steps: We need to investigate both partners. We may recommend supplements for 3 months before trying again.
reassurance: This is painful, but informative. It tells us we need to work on gamete quality before generating embryos again.
call_to_action: I know you are disappointed. Take today to grieve. Let's talk strategy on Monday.

context: [EMPATHY] I am calling with difficult news from the embryology lab.
explanation: None of the embryos developed into Blastocysts suitable for transfer or freezing. They all degenerated after Day 3.
next_steps: This cycle is cancelled. We will not charge you for the transfer or freezing steps.
reassurance: This is a severe outcome, but not the end of the road. It might be time to discuss if 'Donor Eggs' or 'Donor Sperm' would give us the success we want, depending on whose cells we suspect.
call_to_action: I want to see you in clinic to show you the growth charts and explain better.

context: Following our call about the lab results.
explanation: We know how devastating it is to have no embryos to transfer. We are all saddened by this outcome.
next_steps: We have arranged a 'Failed Cycle Review' meeting with the Lab Director and Doctor for {{next_consult_date}}.
reassurance: Please don't give up. We just need to find the right key for the lock.
call_to_action: Please confirm if you can attend the review meeting.

context: Ultrasound showed 1 strong heartbeat, but the second sac has stopped growing.
explanation: This is 'Vanishing Twin Syndrome'. One embryo is continuing perfectly (Heartbeat: {{heartbeat_bpm}} bpm), while the other has been reabsorbed. This is very common in IVF (20-30% of twin starts).
next_steps: Focus on the healthy baby! The vanishing twin does NOT harm the survivor.
reassurance: You are still pregnant with a healthy baby! This is actually safer for you than a twin pregnancy.
call_to_action: Continue all meds as prescribed. Next scan in 2 weeks.

context: I wanted to explain what we saw on the scan today.
explanation: We saw two sacs initially, but today only one has a heartbeat. The other sac is empty. This is nature's way of reducing a high-risk twin pregnancy to a safer singleton pregnancy.
next_steps: You may have some light spotting as the tissue resolves - do not panic.
reassurance: The remaining baby is growing perfectly on track. You have a healthy pregnancy.
call_to_action: Any questions? I don't want you worrying about the loss, focus on the life.

context: Scan update: Ek baby bilkul healthy hai! â¤ï¸
explanation: Dusra sac grow nahi kar raha (Vanishing Twin). Ye IVF mein aksar hota hai. God has decided that one healthy baby is best for you right now.
next_steps: Healthy baby ki heartbeat {{heartbeat_bpm}} hai - very strong! ðŸ’ª
reassurance: Daro mat, jo baby bacha hai wo bilkul safe hai. Twins pregnancy risky hoti hai, single pregnancy safest hai.
call_to_action: Happy raho! You are going to be a mother.

explanation: You have received the injection to treat the ectopic pregnancy. This stops the cells from dividing.
next_steps:
1. Do NOT take prenatal vitamins/folic acid (it stops the med from working).
2. Avoid sun exposure.
3. Expect some abdominal pain.
reassurance: This treatment usually works well and saves your tubes for future pregnancy.
call_to_action: Come for repeat Beta hCG on Day 4 and Day 7. This is critical to ensure levels drop.

explanation: Pain/bleeding reported is concerning. Risk of tube rupture.
next_steps: Come to clinic IMMEDIATELY. If clinic closed, go to nearest Hospital ER.
reassurance: Better to be safe.

context: Explaining the drop in your beta hCG levels (Biochemical Pregnancy).
explanation: The embryo started to implant (hence positive test) but stopped developing very early. It's a very early miscarriage.
next_steps: Stop medications. Your period will start in 3-5 days. It may be heavier than usual.
reassurance: The Silver Lining: Implantation HAPPENED! This proves your uterus can accept an embryo. Patients with biochemicals often have high success in the very next cycle.
call_to_action: Let's track your hCG to zero next week, then plan the next transfer.

context: [GENTLE] I'm calling about your second beta result.
explanation: The level has dropped from {{beta_value_1}} to {{beta_value_2}}. This confirms a 'Chemical Pregnancy'. The pregnancy was there, but it didn't stay.
next_steps: It's physically just like a period. You don't need surgery or D&C.
reassurance: I know this is teasingâ€”to have a positive then lose it. But medically, it's a good prognostic sign for the future compared to no implantation at all. Your body tried.
call_to_action: Take care of yourself. Call us when the bleeding starts.

context: [GENTLE] I need to discuss the ultrasound findings.
explanation: We can see the gestational sac has grown, but unfortunately, it is empty. No embryo/yolk sac developed inside. This is called an 'Anembryonic Pregnancy' or Blighted Ovum.
next_steps: We have 3 options: 1. Wait for natural miscarriage. 2. Take medication (Misoprostol) to start it. 3. D&C procedure (cleaning).
reassurance: This is almost always a random genetic error in that specific embryo. It does not mean it will happen again.
call_to_action: I recommend the D&C so we can test the tissue and confirm the genetic cause. What do you think?

context: Follow up after our scan discussion.
explanation: I know the diagnosis of Blighted Ovum is confusing - looking pregnant but no baby. It is a cruel trick of nature.
next_steps: You have chosen the D&C option. Please come fasting (no food/water) tomorrow at 8 AM.
reassurance: The procedure is painless (under anesthesia) and over in 15 mins. You will recover physically in 1 day.

context: [EMPATHY] Since the pregnancy is not viable, we need to manage the miscarriage safely.
explanation:
Option 1: Expectant (Wait for it to happen naturally). 
Option 2: Medical (Tablets to induce bleeding at home - can be painful). 
Option 3: Surgical (D&C - quick, asleep, done in clinic).
next_steps: For IVF patients, I often suggest D&C so we can do genetic testing on the tissue (POC testing) to learn WHY this happened.
reassurance: There is no wrong choice. Choose what feels best for your mental health.
call_to_action: Discuss with your partner and text me your decision by evening.

explanation:
**1. Natural:** Unpredictable timing, heavy bleeding. 
**2. Meds:** Controlled timing, strong cramps/bleeding at home. 
**3. Surgery (D&C):** Scheduled, painless, over quickly.
next_steps: Let us know your preference.
reassurance: All options are safe. We are here to support you through the physical process.
call_to_action: If you choose Meds/Natural, buy extra thick pads and painkillers.

explanation: Agar aap D&C (cleaning) choose karte ho, toh ye sabse painless option hai. Aap behosh honge (anesthesia) aur 10 min mein procedure khatam. Ghar pe dard bardasht nahi karna padega.
next_steps: Agar aap ready hain, toh hum kal ka slot book kar sakte hain.
reassurance: Hum aapke saath hain. Daro mat. Physical recovery jaldi ho jayegi.

context: Since we have had 3 failed transfers, we need to dig deeper.
explanation: We are classifying this as 'Recurrent Implantation Failure' (RIF). Standard IVF isn't working, so we investigate.
next_steps:
**Tests needed:** 
1. ERA (Endometrial Receptivity Analysis) 
2. Hysteroscopy (Camera inside uterus) 
3. TB PCR (Rule out latent TB) 
4. Karyotyping (Genetics for parents)
reassurance: Often, it's just a timing issue (ERA) or a small polyp. Finding the cause is the key to success!
call_to_action: These tests cost approx â‚¹50k total. Shall we proceed next cycle?

context: I want to propose a 'Investigative Cycle' before we transfer any more embryos.
explanation: We have good embryos, but they aren't sticking. We need to check the 'soil' (uterus). I recommend a Hysteroscopy and an ERA test.
next_steps: We will skip a month of transfer and just do these tests. The ERA involves taking a biopsy of the lining at the exact time we would usually transfer.
reassurance: I have had many patients who failed 3 times, did the ERA, adjusted the timing by 12 hours, and got pregnant immediately. It's worth checking.
call_to_action: Come in on Day 2 so I can explain the timeline.

context: 3 attempts fail huye hain. Ab hum 'Blind' nahi chal sakte.
explanation: Hume investigate karna padega ki rejection kyu ho raha hai. India mein 'Genital TB' (Tuberculosis) ek common reason hai silent failure ka.
next_steps: Hum uterine tissue lekar TB PCR aur CD-138 (infection) ka test karenge.
reassurance: Agar infection mila, toh antibiotics se cure ho jayega aur pregnancy ruk jayegi. Hope mat chhodo.
call_to_action: Let's meet to discuss the testing plan.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, looking forward to meeting you! ðŸ‘‹
context: I know the first visit to a fertility clinic can be nerve-wracking.
explanation: Tomorrow is just a 'fact-finding' mission. No big decisions need to be made instantly. We will just review your history, do a basic scan, and explain the science.
next_steps: Bring: Previous reports (HSG, semen analysis), ID proof, and a list of questions written down so you don't forget them.
reassurance: You are taking the first brave step towards your family. We are here to hold your hand, not to judge.
call_to_action: Please confirm your arrival time. Valet parking is available.

greeting: Hello {{patient_name}}, this is the intake nurse.
context: [WARM TONE] I'm calling to confirm your appointment and check how you're feeling about coming in.
explanation: It is completely normal to feel anxious or scared that you'll get 'bad news'. But remember, information is power. Knowing what's wrong is the only way to fix it.
next_steps: Dr. {{doctor_name}} is very gentle. We will start with a chat, not an exam.
reassurance: Most patients leave the first consult feeling relieved because they finally have a plan.
call_to_action: Do you have any specific fears I can note down for the doctor beforehand?

context: Kal aapka pehla appointment hai humare saath.
explanation: Pehli baar fertility clinic aana thoda stressful ho sakta hai. Tension mat lijiye. Hum bas baat karenge aur samjhenge ki dikkat kahan hai.
next_steps: Apne husband {{partner_name}} ke saath aana best rahega. Purani files saath layein.
reassurance: Aap akele nahi hain. Har roz naye couples aate hain aur khushi khushi parents ban kar jaate hain. Bas pehla step mushkil lagta hai. ðŸ’š

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, regarding the treatment estimate. ðŸ’°
context: I know the cost of IVF (approx â‚¹1.5-2L) is a major concern.
explanation: We want you to focus on the baby, not the bill. We have partnered with medical loan providers (Liquiloans/Bajaj) to offer 0% Interest EMI options.
next_steps: You can split the cost into 9 or 12 monthly installments. Approval takes 2 hours with just PAN/Aadhar card.
reassurance: We can also look at 'Minimal Stimulation' protocols which use fewer injections to save cost, if you are a good candidate.
call_to_action: Should I ask the finance manager to call you with the EMI breakdown?

context: Treatment costs ko lekar agar aap pareshan hain, toh please baat karein.
explanation: Paisa ki chinta hona natural hai. Humare paas flexible payment plans hain. Aap ek saath pay karne ki jagah 'Step-by-Step' pay kar sakte hain (pehle stimulation, fir lab, fir transfer).
next_steps: Humare counselor se mil lijiye. Wo aapko best package guide karenge.
reassurance: Money should not be the barrier to your parenthood. Hum kuch na kuch rasta nikal lenge.
call_to_action: Reply 'FINANCE' agar aap call chahte hain.

context: [GENTLE] I noticed some tension during the consultation today, which is very common.
explanation: Infertility is one of the hardest things a marriage can go through. It changes intimacy into a 'schedule' and adds blame or guilt. It is not anyone's faultâ€”it is a medical condition.
next_steps: I strongly suggest a 'date night' with NO baby talk. Reconnect as a couple, not just as 'potential parents'.
reassurance: Couples who survive IVF often have the strongest marriages because they have fought a war together. Be kind to each other.
call_to_action: We have a relationship counselor available on Saturdays if you want to talk.

explanation: The hormone injections can make you irritable, and the pressure on him for samples is stressful. If you guys are fighting more than usual, it's the IVF speaking, not the lack of love.
next_steps: Try to designate 20 mins a day to talk about IVF, then ban the topic for the rest of the evening.
reassurance: This phase is temporary. Your relationship is the permanent foundation for the child you are trying to bring.
call_to_action: Here is a link to a support group for couples: [Link]

context: Bas remind karna tha ki is journey mein partner ka support sabse zaroori hai.
explanation: Kabhi kabhi hum treatment mein itna kho jate hain ki marriage suffer karti hai. Ek dusre ko blame mat karna.
next_steps: Aaj shaam ko kuch non-medical discuss karna. Movie dekho ya bahar jao.
reassurance: Ye mushkil waqt aap dono ko strong banayega. You are a team! ðŸ¤

context: You mentioned the pressure from in-laws was becoming unmanageable.
explanation: In our culture, everyone feels entitled to ask 'Good News kab sunaoge?'. You need to know that your medical history is PRIVATE. You do not owe anyone an explanation.
next_steps: Practice a standard reply: 'We are focusing on our careers/health right now. We will let you know when there is news.' Then change the subject.
reassurance: Setting boundaries doesn't make you a bad daughter-in-law. It makes you a sane patient. Stress affects success rates, so protect your peace.
call_to_action: Do you want to role-play this conversation?

explanation: It's okay to skip family functions if they trigger you. Prioritize your mental health.
next_steps: Counseling available if you need venting space.
reassurance: Your journey, your timeline.

context: You are 5 days post-transfer. This is usually when the anxiety peaks.
explanation: You might be symptom spotting. 'Do my breasts hurt? Do I feel cramps?' Please remember, progesterone causes ALL these symptoms even if you aren't pregnant. Symptoms tell us nothing.
next_steps: Stay off Google. It is a rabbit hole of anxiety. Watch a comedy series instead.
reassurance: The embryo is safe inside. Stressing won't un-implant it, but relaxing makes the wait bearable.
call_to_action: Hang in there. Only {{days_left}} days to the beta test.

explanation: Ghar pe Urine Test mat karna. Wo early stages mein negative aa sakta hai jo galat hoga.
next_steps: Beta Blood test {{beta_date}} ko hi final maana jayega.
reassurance: Positive socho! ðŸ¤ž

context: It's been a week since the results.
explanation: I hope you are taking time to heal. It's okay to cry, scream, or do nothing. You are grieving a dream.
next_steps: Dr. {{doctor_name}} has reviewed your file. We have some ideas for what to change next time (different protocol/testing).
reassurance: But for now, just breathe. Your body and mind need a break. We are ready when you are.
call_to_action: We have an online support group meeting on Sunday. Join if you like.

context: Ek hafta ho gaya result ko. Kaise feel kar rahe ho?
explanation: Agar aap abhi kisi se baat nahi karna chahte, toh its okay. Grief ka koi timeline nahi hota.
next_steps: Jab aap ready feel karein, hum ek 'Cycle Review' meeting rakh sakte hain.
reassurance: Haar mat maanna. Bohot se patients first attempt mein fail hote hain par finally succeed karte hain.
call_to_action: Counselor se baat karni hai? Reply 'YES'.

greeting: Hello {{patient_name}}, congratulations on the positive scan!
context: [EMPATHY] I know you aren't celebrating yet because of your previous miscarriage.
explanation: Pregnancy after loss is a unique kind of anxiety. Every cramp feels like a threat. But this pregnancy is different. The embryo is PGT-A tested/stronger.
next_steps: We will monitor you more closely. You can come for scans every week if that helps your anxiety.
reassurance: Today, at this moment, you are pregnant and the baby is okay. Take it one day at a time.
call_to_action: Call me directly if you have any spotting. I'm here for you.

explanation: I know you've been holding your breath. Passing the milestone of your previous loss is huge.
next_steps: Continue your medications. The placenta is taking over now.
reassurance: Different egg, different sperm, different pregnancy. The odds are in your favor this time.

context: We discussed the Donor Egg option yesterday, and I know it's a big shift mentally.
explanation: Many women worry, 'Will the baby be mine?'. Biologically, you are the one building the baby. Your blood, your oxygen, your body grows the child. Epigenetics shows that the womb environment influences how genes express.
next_steps: Take time to mourn the genetic link. It is a real loss. But the bond of motherhood comes from carrying and raising, not just DNA.
reassurance: Once the baby is in your arms, 99% of patients tell me they forget it was a donor egg. They just see their child.
call_to_action: Do you want to speak to another patient who used a donor?

explanation: The donor provides the cell, but YOU provide the life. You are the mother in every way that matters.
next_steps: Our donor database has profiles with detailed medical history and childhood photos to help you match characteristics.
reassurance: Success rates with donor eggs jump to 60-70% because the eggs are young (age 21-25). It is the fastest route to a baby.
call_to_action: Let us know if you want to see the profiles.

context: Donor egg ke baare mein jo baat hui thi...
explanation: Genetic link na hone ka dukh natural hai. Par yaad rakhna, bachha khoon se nahi, pyaar aur parvarish se banta hai. Aap hi usse 9 months carry karogi.
next_steps: Donor sirf 'ek cell' de rahi hai. Baaki sab aapka hai.
reassurance: Duniya ke liye wo aapka aur {{partner_name}} ka hi bachha hoga. Hum confidentiality maintain karte hain.
call_to_action: Sochiye is baare mein. Humare counselor se baat kar sakte hain.

context: Following up on our difficult conversation yesterday.
explanation: Deciding to stop IVF is not 'giving up'. It is choosing to prioritize your life, your body, and your marriage over medical procedures.
next_steps: Here are the resources I mentioned regarding adoption and child-free living communities.
reassurance: You are whole and complete, with or without a biological child. We are proud of how hard you fought.
call_to_action: Our door is always open if you change your mind, but take care of yourself now.

context: Here is the financial breakdown for your upcoming IVF cycle.
explanation:
Attached is the PDF with package details. 
**Inclusions:** Scans, Doctor Fees, OT Charges, Anesthesia. 
**Exclusions:** Stimulation Injections (approx â‚¹60-80k), Pharmacy, Blood tests.
next_steps: Please review. Payment is due in 2 parts: 50% on Day 2, 50% on Pickup Day.
reassurance: No hidden OT charges. We believe in transparency.
call_to_action: Let us know if you need the EMI loan paperwork.

explanation: Generally, standard Mediclaim policies in India do NOT cover IVF/Infertility. They consider it 'planned' or 'cosmetic'. However, some corporate policies (GIPSA/MNCs) do have a sub-limit for fertility.
next_steps: Please check your policy wording for 'Fertility Treatment'. If covered, we need the TPA Approval Letter before admission.
reassurance: We will provide all necessary documents/letters to help you file for reimbursement if eligible.
call_to_action: Send us your policy card photo to verify.

explanation: Your insurer has approved â‚¹{{amount}} for the procedure. Balance â‚¹{{balance}} must be paid by you.
next_steps: Pay balance at admission desk.
reassurance: Approval received.

explanation: We offer 0% Interest EMI for 6, 9, or 12 months via Liquiloans.
next_steps:
**Documents needed:** PAN Card, Aadhar Card, Last 3 months Bank Statement. 
**Process:** Digital sign on mobile. Approval in 2 hours.
reassurance: You don't need a credit card. It is a medical loan.
call_to_action: Come 30 mins early to process this before your appointment.

explanation: The total package is â‚¹1.5L. If you pay upfront, we offer a 5% discount. Or we can do the EMI route.
next_steps: The EMI would be approx â‚¹12,500 per month for 12 months.
reassurance: There is no processing fee and no foreclosure charges if you want to pay it off early.
call_to_action: Which option works better for your budget?

explanation: You need: {{medication}} {{dose}}. Order now for Day 2 start.
next_steps: Call pharmacy at Ext 102.
reassurance: Keep in fridge immediately.

explanation: Aapko Gonal-F / Menopur chahiye hoga. Note karein ki ye **Cold Chain** medicines hain.
next_steps: Jaise hi delivery aaye, unhe turant Fridge ke door compartment mein rakhein. Freezer mein NAHI rakhna (jum jayega toh kharab ho jayega).
reassurance: Ice pack ke saath delivery aayegi.
call_to_action: Milne par photo bhejein confirm karne ke liye.

explanation: Follicular Study Scan at {{appt_time}}.
next_steps:
1. Drink water (Full Bladder required). 
2. Bring your Injection File/Chart.
reassurance: We will check how the eggs are growing.

explanation: Your Hormone/Semen Analysis results are ready.
next_steps: Pickup from reception Mon-Sat, 9am-6pm.
reassurance: Dr will discuss in next consult.

explanation: You are approaching Day 8 of stimulation. You might need a refill of {{medication}}.
next_steps: Count your vials today. If you have less than 2 days' stock, order immediately.
reassurance: Don't run out! Missing a dose affects the cycle.

explanation: Progesterone medicines khatam hone wali hain?
next_steps: Renewal ke liye call karein. Treatment beech mein rukna nahi chahiye.
reassurance: Pharmacy home delivery available hai.

context: Regarding your request for medical records/file.
explanation: You have full rights to your medical data. We need a formal request to release the file.
next_steps:
1. Fill the 'Records Release Form'. 
2. Attach ID proof. 
3. Pay administrative fee â‚¹500.
reassurance: We will prepare the full file (Scans, Lab reports, OT notes) within 7 days.
call_to_action: Stop by reception to sign the form.

context: Supporting your decision for a second opinion.
explanation: We understand you want to consult another expert. That is completely okay! We want you to feel confident.
next_steps: We have compiled your summary report. You can share this with the other doctor so you don't have to repeat tests.
reassurance: Your embryos remain safe with us regardless. We just want your success.
call_to_action: The file is ready for pickup.

context: I heard you are seeking a second opinion.
explanation: I fully support this. Sometimes a fresh pair of eyes helps. I will ensure all your records are transparently shared.
next_steps: If the new doctor suggests a protocol change we haven't tried, let me know. We can collaborate.
reassurance: Please don't feel awkward. This is about your baby, not my ego.
call_to_action: Let me know if you need any specific test results emailed.

context: Moving your embryos to another clinic.
explanation: We need to coordinate the 'Cryo-Shipping'.
next_steps:
1. Need 'Acceptance Letter' from new clinic. 
2. Hire a specialized courier (e.g., CryoShip). 
3. Sign 'Release of Liability' form.
reassurance: We will ensure the tank is sealed and nitrogen levels are safe before handover.
call_to_action: Coordinate the date with us 1 week in advance.

context: Since you are moving to a clinic in your hometown.
explanation: We have packed your discharge summary and CD of all scans.
next_steps: Hand this to your new doctor. It explains exactly what meds you were on.
reassurance: We wish you all the best! You are always welcome back if things change.

explanation: Aaj aapka appointment tha jo miss ho gaya.
next_steps: Treatment mein gap na aaye isliye reschedule karna zaroori hai.
reassurance: Kal ka slot available hai.

explanation: The report shows 'Azoospermia', which means zero sperm count in the ejaculate. However, this does NOT mean there is no sperm produced inside the testis.
next_steps: We need to determine if it's 'Obstructive' (blockage) or 'Non-Obstructive' (production issue). Hormone tests (FSH) will tell us.
reassurance: For many men, we can retrieve sperm directly from the testicle (TESA) via a small needle. You can still be a biological father.

explanation: Report mein sperm count nil aaya hai. Ghabraiye mat, iska ilaaj hai.
next_steps: Hum ek chhota procedure (TESA) karke sperm nikal sakte hain. Sui (needle) se sperm liya jayega.
reassurance: Bohot se cases mein blockage hoti hai par sperm ban raha hota hai.

explanation: You have a Grade 3 Varicocele (swollen veins) which is heating up the testicles and killing sperm.
next_steps: Option A: Microsurgery (results take 6 months). Option B: Proceed directly to IVF-ICSI (bypass the problem).
reassurance: Since your wife is also {{patient_age}}, I recommend IVF to save time.

explanation: Dr. recommends skipping surgery as it delays pregnancy by 6-9 months.
next_steps: ICSI can select the best sperm despite the varicocele.
reassurance: Saving time is crucial.

explanation: Your DFI (DNA Fragmentation Index) is 35%. Normal is <15%. This means the DNA inside the sperm is breaking.
next_steps: This explains the miscarriages. We need to use 'MACS' (Magnetic Sorting) or 'Microfluidics' during ICSI to filter out damaged sperm.
reassurance: We can select the healthy ones. But you must stop smoking immediately.

explanation: Sperm ke andar DNA damage mila hai (High Fragmentation). Is wajah se embryos weak bante hain.
next_steps: Hum IVF mein special technique (MACS) use karenge achhe sperm chunnane ke liye.
reassurance: Isse success rate badhega.

explanation: Morphology (Shape) is 2% (Normal >4%). Your sperm have shape defects making it hard to penetrate the egg.
next_steps: Solution: ICSI. We inject the sperm so it doesn't need to penetrate on its own.
reassurance: The genetic material inside is usually fine, only the outer shape is the issue.

explanation: Low morphology (shape issue). Natural conception unlikely.
next_steps: ICSI recommended.
reassurance: Solvable problem.

explanation: Because of your diabetes/surgery, the semen is going backward into the bladder instead of out (Dry Ejaculation).
next_steps: We need to collect your urine immediately after orgasm. We will alkalize your urine with soda-bicarb pills first.
reassurance: We can recover plenty of sperm from the urine for IVF.

explanation: The genetic test shows a deletion on the Y-chromosome (AZFc region). This causes low sperm count.
next_steps: If we use your sperm, any male child will inherit the same infertility. Female children will be fine.
reassurance: We can do PGT-A/PGT-M to select female embryos if you wish to avoid passing it on.

explanation: Karyotype shows Balanced Translocation. This causes sperm production issues.
next_steps: PGT-SR (Structural Rearrangement) testing of embryos is mandatory.
reassurance: We can find the balanced embryos.

explanation: Procedure is tomorrow. Local anesthesia. Quick needle aspiration.
next_steps: Shave the scrotal area today. Wear tight underwear/supporter tomorrow.
reassurance: It is not surgery, just a needle prick.

explanation: Kal TESA hoga. Dard nahi hoga (Sunn karne ka injection denge).
next_steps: Tight underwear pehen kar aana support ke liye.
reassurance: Aadhe ghante mein ghar ja sakte hain.

explanation: Use ice pack on scrotum. Take painkiller if needed.
next_steps: No heavy lifting/gym for 3 days.
reassurance: Found good sperm!

explanation: Dr has prescribed CoQ10, Zinc, and Lycopene.
next_steps: Sperm takes 72 days to generate. You must take these for 3 months for effect.
reassurance: This can lower DFI significantly.

explanation: IVF success ke liye aapko Smoking aur Alcohol band karna hoga 3 mahine.
next_steps: Laptop god mein rakh kar kaam na karein (Heat issue).
reassurance: Achhi quality sperm = Healthy baby.

explanation: We are trying TESA to find your sperm. But in case we find nothing, we need a Plan B so we don't waste the eggs retrieved from your wife.
next_steps: Do we have your consent to use Donor Sperm as a backup? Or should we freeze the eggs?
reassurance: We hope to find your sperm, but being prepared is smart.

explanation: Since you have had 2+ losses, we are running the 'RPL Panel'.
next_steps: Blood tests: Karyotype (Parents), APLA (Clotting), Thrombophilia, Thyroid, Prolactin.
reassurance: Finding the cause prevents future heartbreak.

explanation: Baar baar miscarriage kyu ho raha hai, ye janne ke liye kuch tests zaroori hain.
next_steps: Hum Genetics aur Blood Clotting check karenge.
reassurance: Agar problem mili, toh uska solution bhi mil jayega.

explanation: Your blood shows antibodies that cause tiny clots in the placenta, cutting off baby's food supply. This caused the losses.
next_steps: Treatment: Blood thinner injections (Lovenox/Clexane) + Aspirin daily throughout pregnancy.
reassurance: With this treatment, success rates are over 80%. We found the culprit!

explanation: Start Low Molecular Weight Heparin (LMWH) injections from the day of positive test.
next_steps: Injection in tummy daily at same time.
reassurance: It stings a bit, but it saves the baby.

explanation: One parent has a 'Balanced Translocation'. Your genes are fine, but when you make egg/sperm, they get scrambled.
next_steps: This causes the miscarriages. We MUST do IVF with PGT-SR to find the balanced embryos.
reassurance: You can have a healthy child, we just need to filter the embryos.

explanation: Report mein 'Translocation' aaya hai. Matlab chromosomes ki jagah badli hui hai.
next_steps: Normal pregnancy mein risk hai. PGT-SR testing zaroori hai.
reassurance: Technology se hum healthy embryo dhund sakte hain.

explanation: You have a wall (septum) dividing your uterus. This leaves less space for the baby and causes miscarriage.
next_steps: Hysteroscopic Resection (Surgery) to cut the septum.
reassurance: It is a day-care procedure. You can try for pregnancy 1 month later.

explanation: The septum is quite deep. It explains the second trimester loss.
next_steps: I strongly advise cutting it before the next transfer.
reassurance: Your uterus will be one unified cavity after this, perfect for carrying.

explanation: We found scarring (synechiae) inside the uterus, likely from a previous D&C. This is Asherman's.
next_steps: We cut the bands today. You need to take high-dose Estrogen for 30 days to regrow the lining.
reassurance: We placed a balloon/coil to keep walls apart. It is treatable.

explanation: Surgery went well. Adhesions removed.
next_steps: Estrogen 8mg daily is crucial to prevent re-scarring.
reassurance: Lining should recover.

explanation: Due to high NK Cells (Natural Killer Cells), we are adding Intralipids/IVIG.
next_steps: Infusion takes 3 hours. Scheduled for Day 7 and Day of Transfer.
reassurance: This suppresses the immune system from attacking the embryo.
